title: Philip Morris Stock Upgraded to a Buy After Failed Merger With Altria
text:
Philip Morris International is rising on Tuesday, helped by an upgrade from Bank of America Merrill Lynch. The firm argues that without the specter of a merger, the tobacco maker’s shares should benefit from an attractive valuation and strong positioning in the reduced-risk smoking space.

The back story. Philip Morris stock (ticker: PM) has climbed over 14% year to date, trailing the S&P 500’s gain of nearly 19% over the same period. Philip Morris had been running ahead of the broader market, but the shares took a hit...
description: Bank of America Merrill Lynch argues that its shares should benefit from an attractive valuation and strong positioning in the reduced-risk smoking space.
